steps.text: In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together 2 cups of the cake flour, baking powder, salt, and ground ginger. Set aside.
In a mixer with paddle attachment, beat together 2 ounces of the butter and 0.75 cups of the sugar on medium speed until light and fluffy, approximately 1 minute.
Add the egg and beat until well incorporated, about 30 seconds.
Add 1/3 of the flour mixture and beat on low speed until incorporated, then add 1/3 of the milk and beat until incorporated. Repeat, alternating flour and milk mixture until everything is combined.
Gently stir in the blueberries and pour the mixture into a greased 9" x 9" baking pan.

In a small bowl combine the nutmeg with the remaining sugar and cake flour. Add the chilled and cubed butter and work into the dry ingredients using a fork to combine. Continue until the mixture has a crumb-like texture.
Sprinkle the mixture on top of the cake.
Bake in the middle rack of the oven for 35 minutes or until golden in color. Cool at least 10 minutes before serving.
